About application
Help
Thank you for downloading and using the Orientation Lock. Here is the Help section.

The app targets Android handsets. On many of them, the you can either leave your screen orientation unlocked, or lock it to the portrait mode (0 degree). That may cause some inconvenience if you are watching some videos on YouTube or browsers and you want to lock the screen orientation to landscape in order to keep the video full screen. 

The app is made for that purpose. By using the app, you can lock your device screen orientation to landscape mode to enjoy full screen videos, images or using some other apps without interruption. You can also use the app to lock your screen orientation to portrait mode as well. 

The app has no effect on apps and games that specifically request fixed orientation, for example: homescreen launchers, Hay Day, Asphalt 8. Please don't blame and ask me to find a way to interrupt these apps and games.
How to use the app?

You\'ll need to open the app, rotate your screen to the orientation you need (mostly landscape), then hit the floating button to lock the orientation, then go back to your app or home screen to launch the other app you want to launch. Please note that if your launcher explicitly requests portrait orientation then the screen will rotate back to portrait mode. After you open the other app, the screen will go right back to the landscape/portrait mode you expect.
Why isn\'t there a homescreen widget?

I have tried implemented the feature and yes, it works some how. However, here are some drawbacks that make me decide to stop working on it: 

- It requires your homescreen launcher does not have fixed orientation, in the other word, the launcher must support both portrait and landscape modes, which most of default launchers, both by device manufacturers and some on Play Store, don't. 

- It requires a background service running all the time, so that will negatively affect battery life. 

- It lags on many devices, especially on low-end ones. 

NOW YOU HAVE QUICK MODE TO QUICKLY LOCK YOUR SCREEN ORIENTATION TO LANDSCAPE_90. Please hit Quick mode from the previous Activity for more details.
Why doesn\'t the app change the default Quick Settings Tile?

Yes, there are some apps that change the behaviour of the default QS Tile, but I don\'t do so because that may cause some trouble to your device configuration. Most importantly, they won\'t undo any changes they make to your device system. My app does not. In case you don\'t like SOL, you can simply remove it and there would be no problem with your device system.
Once you have the app installed, please don\'t use it wrong.

- It doesn\'t change the behaviour of the default QS Tile: As I said above, it does not. Some brainless users, I don\'t know why, think that once the app is installed then they can lock the screen orientation to landscape mode BY THE BUILT-IN QS Tile. NO. You\'ll need to use the app. \n\n- It doesn\'t mess the soft keys: That depends on your customised Android variant by your manufacturer and that\'s their problem, not mine. If this app messes your keys, other similar apps on Play Store also do the same.
Known issues

The floating button lags on KitKat and earlier Android versions (Android 4.X) in landscape mode: That\'s the problem of FloatingActionButton class on Android 4.X. I tried a lot to fix it but I can\'t. Unless Google releases a new version of the class, I can do nothing.
